name: immovably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe how someone has a firm opinion that is impossible to change: She remains immovably certain of the result. He is immovably hostile to any variant of socialism.
in a way that is fixed and impossible to move: The ship was immovably locked in the solid ice of the Weddell Sea, where it would remain for 11 months. Most of the objects were now immovably set in the dried mud and could only be recovered with a pick.
